thread.title: Armed robbers strike Wolverhampton travel agency
thread.title_full: Armed robbers strike Wolverhampton travel agency

title: Armed robbers strike Wolverhampton travel agency
text:
Save 
A travel agency in Wolverhampton was threatened by armed raiders on Friday, before the robbers made off with a number of different currencies from its foreign exchange desk. 
The two men struck the Holiday Hypermarket on Friday, armed with weapons before they escaped with the cash, which is understood to have included Canadian dollars, Egyptian pounds, euros, Thai bhatt, Turkish lira and US dollars. 
Detectives have said they believe the pair could try to offload the cash, and are appealing to anyone with information to come forward, local news site the Express & Star reported. 
Detective Sergeant Steve Walters, from the Acquisitive Crime Team in Wolverhampton, said: “Our enquiries continue into the robbery but I believe the duo were after cash and will need to off load it somehow. 
“I am appealing to anyone who has been offered foreign currency, or anyone who has been asked to convert a large amount of foreign currency that may have seemed suspicious. 
“No matter how insignificant you feel the information is, it may be crucial to solving this case. 
“Fortunately no members of staff were hurt during the robbery but obviously were left very shaken by their ordeal.”
